work.p: Draft of a poem that was never published in Whitman's lifetime. It contains the line "world, take good notice!" and refers to "thirty-four stars" where "World, Take Good Notice" describes a group of stars as "coals thirty-eight."

lg.l: Change, tattered cloth—your silver group withdrawing;
Bring we threads of scarlet, in vacant spots resetting,
World, take good notice! the silver group has vanished;
Notice clustering now, as coals of molten iron,
Timely, warning baleful, off these western shores,
